channel.title: Runescape... book!?
channel.description:
In the coming months, you can expect a lot from the Jagex Store. Plans are afoot to bring you a range of RuneScape merchandise to buy, including many that you voted for in the 'Shop till you Drop' poll. One of these items is available for pre-order now: the first ever official RuneScape novel, Betrayal at Falador by T.S. Church. This fantasy epic opens with the discovery of a mysterious woman, found close to death within the walls of Falador Castle. Sir Amik and the White Knights are determined to reveal the identity of her attacker, thought to be a monster seen attacking travellers on the outskirts of Asgarnia. The question is: can the monster really be the blacksmith Doric, newly arrived from Keldagrim? This Limited Edition hardback is available for pre-order now, and will be released on the 21st of July. Visit the Jagex Store to find out more, and keep an eye out for more news on available RuneScape merchandise.
What the fuck were they thinking?

All we learn is there are 3 gods, and their standing with each other. There is 90000 million pages of lore in the varrock tavern, no one reads it because it’s bullcrap, you can learn quite a bit doing quests, but that includes playing.
Things like WoW, we’re planned, they release 3 games to show the lore behind the game before releasing a game.[/quote]

There’s more than three gods. There’s like 5.

item.title: Runescape... book!?
item.dc:creator: @Doggie3342 Doggie3342
item.description:
@Doggie3342 wrote:

exe626:

I don’t see why everybody is so negative towards this, Runescape is a massive game with millions of players, this book will sell greatly. It’s about time Jagex moved to selling merchandise, they’ll make a great deal more money to improve this game.

well, people are being negative because they dont think anyone will buy it and that the book will suck. but seriously, if jagex decided they wanted to start selling merchandise, what other choices do they have? nobody would buy a t-shirt, because then they would have to actually wear it in public, whereas you can read a book and not feel embarrassed about being a complete loser.

EDIT: this is the greatest idea i have had in several weeks: jagex should make a runescape board game.[right][size=1pt]patent pending[/size][/right]

Read full topic
